Keys of a Gamespace fits in that approach of video games, which is linked to Sébastien Genvo’s studies on game design and video games expressive potential. Just like cinema, or comic books, video games are not a minor way of expression. It can also, in its way, deal with serious or tough themes. The following works, for example, were references for our project : Mystic River, EraserHead and Twin Peaks, which happen to be some cinematographic references ; while A distant neighborhood, Black Hole, and American Splendor were some comic books references.

name: Key 2
summary: Spend hours having fun exploring this ever-growing maze. In Key 2, with each level beaten, the maze gets bigger and more hard. Dodge slimes, spikes and traps, find the key and open the door before time runs out.

name: Keep looking
summary: Introduction: This is a game that can bring you more fun when you are bored and unhappy.

name: Keyframes
summary: Between exams, friendships, and figuring out what a savings account is, college might just be one of the busiest times of your life. No one said adulthood was going to be easy, but it’ll be a little less painful to navigate with your two best friends by your side... and three new chance acquaintances, who happen to be the right people at the right time.

name: Kerbal Space Program: Breaking Ground
summary: Kerbal Space Program: Breaking Ground Expansion is the second expansion for the PC version of the critically acclaimed space flight simulator, Kerbal Space Program. This feature-rich expansion is focused on increasing the objective possibilities once celestial bodies have been reached by adding more interesting scientific endeavors and...

name: Kerbal Space Program: Making History
summary: Expand your Kerbal experience like never before with Kerbal Space Program: Making History Expansion. The first expansion pack for the critically acclaimed space simulation game adds new content to Kerbal Space Program, including an immersive Mission Builder, a History Pack featuring missions inspired by historical events, and a wealth of...

name: Keep Out
summary:
Keep Out is a horror and mystery puzzle adventure Game.
A whole story of Keep Out is from Devota Hill in 2044. You are "Mr. M", the toy of a wise and benevolent monarch. Explore and Find Secrets of Devota Hill and HumathScience.

Players explore Devota Hill by manipulating Mr. M in 3D, Side-scrolling views.
You may have to fight, dodge, or sometimes get stuck against aggressive rats, human beings who kill animated toys, and other aggressive toys that don't serve the benevolent lord Mr. M. Sometimes you have to use parts of the toy that were killed to survive. Mr.M is threatened or helped in this environment. You are the lord of toys. With all your toys paying attention to you, think only about salvaging the world of threatened toys!

name: Kemono Heroes
summary:
Kemono Heroes combines elements of run and gun, fast arcade action with dashes and slashes, with cool and fluffy characters. It can be enjoyed up to 4 Players in cooperative mode, fighting together and helping each other but is totally designed to work as a single player game as well.

Play solo, or share Joy-Con controllers for local multiplayer support for up to 4 players. With upgradeable weapons and items, and charming visuals drawn from retro side-scrollers and traditional folklore, Kemono Heroes is truly a vivid and memorable action adventure!

name: Keep Looking
summary: This is a nerve-wracking horror game that puts you in a dark, claustrophobic cave with a relentless creature. Survive by flashing your dying flashlight at the right moments—too soon or too late, and it’s over. You must keep an eye on the creature, but beware: staring too long is just as deadly.

name: Keg & Quest
summary: Keg & Quest is a free-to-play idle RPG with online multiplayer. Build your hero, join a guild, compete in PvP, and take part in world boss events where strategy and progression matter more than reflexes.

name: Kentucky Route Zero
summary:
Kentucky Route Zero is a magical realist adventure game about a secret highway in the caves beneath Kentucky, and the mysterious folks who travel it. Gameplay is inspired by point-and-click adventure games (like the classic Monkey Island or King's Quest series, or more recently Telltale's Walking Dead series), but focused on characterization, atmosphere and storytelling rather than clever puzzles or challenges of skill.

The game is developed by Cardboard Computer (Jake Elliott and Tamas Kemenczy). The game's soundtrack features an original electronic score by Ben Babbitt along with a suite of old hymns & bluegrass standards recorded by The Bedquilt Ramblers.

name: Kerbal Space Program 2
summary: Kerbal Space Program 2 will create a whole new generation of space flight experts who will find themselves accidentally learning rocket science. New animated tutorials, improved UI, and fully revamped assembly and flight instructions allow both experienced and novice players to quickly put their creativity to the test without sacrificing any of the challenges from the original game.

name: Ketsugou Danshi: Elements with Emotions - Zenshi Konkan Pack
Keiba Saisho no Housoku '96 vol.2: G-I Road
Kerbal Space Program
summary: In Kerbal Space Program, take charge of the space program for the alien race known as the Kerbals. You have access to an array of parts to assemble fully-functional spacecraft that flies (or doesn’t) based on realistic aerodynamic and orbital physics. Launch your Kerbal crew into orbit and beyond (while keeping them alive) to explore moons and planets in the Kerbol solar system, constructing bases and space stations to expand the reach of your expedition.

name: Kero Catch
summary: Kero Catcher is a fast paced mini-game where the goal is to eat as many grubs as possible!

name: Kether
summary: A sci-fi hodgepodge of puzzles, space flight and corridor shooting.

name: Kenju
summary:
A 3D fighting game developed by DreamFactory that was slated to hit arcades in 2005 but was subsequently cancelled before launch, even though it had arcade location tests in Japan near the end of 2004 and in january 2005.
It resurfaced years later and got a homebrew port for the Sega Dreamcast in 2021 alongside many other games for the Atomiswave.

name: Keyboard Tennis
summary: Keyboard Tennis, a keyboard-based tennis game, offers both fun and competitive experiences. Players aim to swiftly and accurately return the ball to their opponent using keyboard keys, requiring fast reflexes and precise timing.

name: Keeper's Curse
summary: Welcome to the mysterious and haunted island of “Keeper’s Curse”. In this action-packed survival third-person shooter, you’ll face relentless waves of cursed creatures while unraveling the secrets of the island and striving to escape its sinister grasp.

name: Kens Labyrinth
summary: Aliens from the planet Zogar have abducted your dog, Sparky. You need to overcome the obstacles of Ken's labyrinth and defeat the monsters that populate it to rescue Sparky and get revenge on the aliens.

name: Keeper
summary: A simple but challenging goalkeeping game for the playdate. How many saves can you make before you concede?

name: Keepers of the Forest
summary: The Forest is in Danger. Evil forces are absorbing what magic remains and destroying all in their path. Gain ancient knowledge from powerful spell books long forgotten and create alliances with magical creatures and Gods. Build your strength and defeat the invading forces.

name: Keg War
summary: A Strategic RPG take on TicTacToe!

name: Kenka Bancho 4: Ichinen Sensou
summary: Kenko Bancho 4 is a semi-ironic action/brawler in which you take on the role of a bancho on a quest to become the top bancho at your school.

name: Kettle
summary: A game about police trapping crowds of protesters.

name: Kessler Effect
summary: “Kessler effect” is the interactive adventure movie in the virtual reality, where the viewer directly interacts with the famous actors. The viewer himself might be one of the main characters and can influence the plot development and the movie ending.

name: Keroppi to Keroriinu no Splash Bomb!
summary: Keroppi to Keroriinu no Splash Bomb! is an Action game, developed by Geo Factory and published by Character Soft, which was released in Japan in 1993.

name: Keyhole Spy: Frozen Hotties
summary: Play mini games with sexy girls of Keyhole Spy: Frozen Hotties and find out what's hidden underneath their clothes!

name: Keep On
summary: Keep the blob on the stage.

name: Keep Running
summary: A fun game and casual [/ b] to spend your free time and have fun with your friends as well as challenge them to show who has the most ability [/ b], motor coordination [/ b] and agile reflexes [/ b].

name: Kekkon Zenya
summary: Kekkon "Zenya" is a multimedia disc for the Sega Saturn. It was followed by Kekkon: Marriage.

name: Keep Light
summary: Bruno is looking for those who left him. He wants know the reason. Will he bring the Light to them or no?

name: Keep it Up
summary: A thrilling rock climbing puzzle action game with simple click challenges

name: Keno Gold
summary:
Traditional keno gameplay plus 3 exciting bonus features including Free Games, Win Multiplier and Extra Balls to enhance the experience.
Keno Gold provides hours of fun and enjoyable gameplay with rich graphics and casino-style sounds. You'll feel like you're at the casino, except that you'll still have your money when you're done!
If you like slot machines, poker, Texas hold'em, solitaire or other casino games, you'll love Keno Gold.

name: Keyboardkommander
summary: A true test of your typing skills, Keyboard Kommander is a fast-paced zombie type’em up, and the story of a conspiracy theorist vindicated. Type through five brutal chapters of gameplay to learn the fate of humanity through the eyes of its would-be savior. Need to kill that zombie? Use your words!

name: Keimagus
summary: Batalhe nessa arena mística para decidir quem será o próximo Mestre!

name: Kenchana: Oath of a Magical Spear
summary: 3d beatemup with South East Asia Archipelago theme

name: Keylimba
summary: Interactive keyboard kalimba!

name: Ken's Labyrinth II
summary: An upcoming fan sequel to Ken Silverman's all time classic, Ken's Labyrinth, Powered by GZDoom.

name: Ken Griffey Jr.'s Winning Run
summary:
Ken Griffey Jr.'s Winning Run is a licensed arcade baseball game featuring MLB's own Ken Griffey Jr. Released in 1996, it contains all 28 MLB teams and logos from that time, with rosters containing fictitious names for the players (Ken Griffey Jr being the only real player in the game).

Next to exhibition games, there are different game modes to compete in. In the MLB Challenge, players start with a weak team and go against every major MLB club to go up the rankings. There is also a complete World Series, All-Star games and the MLB League. In the league modes up to eight players can choose a team and play a season of 26, 52 or 162 games. Between matches players can change the line-up and rotation, and trade away players.

name: Keisan Game: Sansuu 5+6-nen
summary: An educational math game for older Japanese students. The last in a series of five games released in 1986 by magazine giant Tokyo Shoseki.

name: KeyHero
summary: KeyHero is a puzzle game. In the game, the key is the only tool for you to pass obstacles.

name: Keikaku
summary: Keikaku aims to bring its player to 90s japan with truly hardcore carbuilding mechanics and various lifesim elements.

name: Kepler Galaxy Wars: Rebel Alliance Mission
summary: Unique and immersive FPS experience in a Sci-fi world on a far away solar system.

name: Keyhole Spy: Naughty Witches
summary: You have a unique chance to use a magic mirror and watch how the most charming witches of the city spend their time.

name: Kenran Butou Sai: The Mars Daybreak
summary:
An Alfa System and Sony Computer Entertainment PlayStation 2 exclusive adventure game

Kenran Butou Sai (絢爛舞踏祭), translates to "The Mars Daybreak", is a real-time simulation adventure game published in Japan by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation 2 on July 7, 2005. The title is a spiritual successor to Gunparade March containing the same style of hybrid gameplay where the player interacts with AI controlled NPCs and then participates in combat segments with them. Sony's Prokion and Alfa System developed Kenran Butou Sai with the title being a part of the studio's larger interconnected universe known as Unkown World.

A television anime based off the world of Kenran Butou Sai, but focusing on a different story and characters, aired a year before the game's launch in 2004 called Mars Daybreak. The show was produced by Bones and was later released in North America by Bandai Entertainment in 2006.

name: Kemco RPG Selection Vol. 8
summary: The 8th volume includes Armed Emeth, Crystal Ortha, Justice Chronicles, and Monster Viator.

name: Keroro Gunsou: MeroMero Battle Royale Z
Ker-Chunk!
summary: Kalva is a bit clumsy, losing all his catnip, but maybe, just maybe, this weird catnip-eating cave has some treasure in it.

name: Keiba Saishou no Housoku '97 Vol. 2: To Hit!
Keep Fe Chicken
summary: A puzzle game where you need to lead fe chickens to holly eggs.

name: Keiji J.B. Harold no Jikenbo: Murder Club
Keyhole Spy: Lots of Girls
summary: In Keyhole Spy: Lots of Girls you'll find the hottest ladies of Keyhole Spy games. If you've never played them, now it's high time to try!

name: Keisan Game: Sansuu 4-nen
summary: An educational math game for Japanese students. The fourth in a series of five games released in 1986 by magazine giant Tokyo Shoseki.

name: Kemono Friends Jump
summary: This is a action/platform fan-made mobile game based on the anime "Kemono Friends" featuring Serval.

name: Kendo
summary: Kendo is a room-scale VR Kendo Training Application.

name: KendamVR: Virtual Reality Kendama
summary: KendamVR Is the world's first virtual reality Kendama game!

name: Kentucky Route Zero: Act III
summary: Conway wakes up, his now-unfamiliar leg treated by Dr. Truman, who lets him know payment will be handled through the Consolidated Power Company. After returning to the Museum of Dwellings and finding it closed, Conway, Shannon and Ezra hit the road again looking for Lula.

name: Keep it alive!
summary: Defend the baby monster with the Force against falling obstacles! A fun physic game to play fast.

name: Keep Rollin!
summary: Funny arcade game with original gameplay. Continue to move and try not to crash into dangerous obstacles!

name: Kenshin Ninja
summary: Kenshin Ninja is an intense platformer with mixed RPG elements. With superior acrobatic and deadly weapons, Kenshin is ready to face menacing traps and enemies who have sworn to protect the shadow devil Som-on.

name: Keep in touch
summary: This is a story about a young hot girl Melanie. One day she goes shopping. Speaking on the phone in the dressing room, she will start share her sexual fantasies with her girlfriend.

name: Kenka Bancho Bros.: Tokyo Battle Royale
summary: Two bros bro it up and take down a mess of bad guys in the latest PSP Kenka Bancho adventure.

name: Keep Me Breathing
summary: Keep a plant alive long enough. Made in 72 hours during the Ludum Dare 46.

name: Ken Griffey Jr.'s Slugfest
summary: Bursting with stunning realism and high-excitement baseball action, Ken Griffey Jr.'s Slugfest drives home the winning run! Improved player animations and color commentary by Dave Niehaus - "The Voice of the Mariners" - make you feel like you're really at the game, while easy-to-use controls, updated rosters and statistics, and an optional fantasy draft make it even more fun than being there!

name: Keiba Saishou no Housoku '99 Aki Fuyu
Keep Me Posted
summary: Deliver mail and get comfy in this warm, yet eldritch action-adventure game. Stamp out your foes, help out a friend, and save the forest before it's too late!

name: Keep Runnin
summary: Keep Runnin is a 2D sidescrolling parkour-platformer game where you navigate through various, visually stunning environments, overcome obstacles, and evade unexpected hazards. Test your reflexes and embrace the excitement of a high-stakes chase in this exhilarating adventure.

name: Key to Heaven
summary: By yourself or with friends, your goal is to fight and explore on the mysterious islands. Become stronger, equip better items, craft a raft and sail parts of the oceans to find more hidden treasure, secrets, and bosses. Beware of other players who are looking to kill you and steal your items.

name: KeyHen
summary: A chicken is destroing your keyboard! Repair it!

name: Kerry and Alice Run into Some Trouble
summary: Pals in space, doing space-jobs.

name: Kenney's Zombies
summary: Kill KENNEY the assets Jesus's ZOMBIE army and put the soccer ball to the goal!!

name: Keriotosse!
summary: Keriotosse! is a Japan only Sega Saturn game.

name: Keep it up!
summary: Stay alive! And keep it up! Keep the frog baby alive!

name: Keyboard Maestro Voyage
summary: "Keyboard Maestro Voyage" is a music game using a MIDI keyboard, simulating real performances. Play in sync with flowing notes in this classic-style game. Start quickly by simply choosing a song and sheet music.

name: Kelder
summary: Trapped in a sinister post-Soviet basement, uncover the truth behind dark experiments and eerie anomalies. Solve puzzles, find keys, and survive against terrifying entities as you explore this atmospheric survival horror. Can you escape the depths of the Kelder?

name: Kernel Quest
summary: Kernel Quest is a sandbox puzzle game. Design and build machines to protect a village against impossible odds.

name: Kettou Beast Wars: Beast Senshi Saikyou Ketteisen
summary: Fighting game based on various incarnations of Beast Wars.

name: Ketchapp Soccer
summary:
Looking for an exciting soccer entertainment in your hands? Here is the Ketchapp Soccer game!
Swipe the ball to hit the targets and score.
There are 3 modes to challenge your friends. Beat the world leaderboards to become the Ketchapp Soccer star!
Collect the stars to unlock new balls, environments, nets and goalkeepers. Improve your skills and become the best Soccer Striker the world has ever seen!

name: Kemeko Deluxe! DS: Yome to Meka to Otoko to Onna
KenKen Pro by Will Shortz
summary: The sequel to the iPhone game, KenKen: Train Your Brain, was released on April 9th, 2010. New features include puzzle grids up to 9x9, achievements, and Facebook integration.

name: Keyhole Spy: Fantasy Passion
summary: Plunge into the magical world and meet enchanting magician who live there. Collect magic items three in a row and see how your wildest and most unusual dreams are coming to life!

name: Keyboard Warrior
summary: Keyboard Warrior is platform game with high tempo battle mechanics using many buttons and the story of a dreamer becoming a keyboard warrior.

name: Kept Man Life

The second is the expansion and war of civilization in a galaxy. The third part is the exploration of god civilization in the universe.

When you set the Joy-Con on your pants and swing it, Ketsu Batller on the screen will also swing his sword in time with your movement! Hit your opponent in the head with your sword and win the game!

Kelluva Linna
summary: Large floating castle using Daiktana E3 textures. Based on an unfinished map for a canceled Nehahra expansion episode from 2005. Comes with a custom skybox.

name: Keep the Lights On

name: Keyboard Sports: Saving Qwerty
summary: You play as the young apprentice to Master QWERTY who takes you on a wild adventure across oceans, through temples and into dreams in the search for your inner key using the entire keyboard as your controller.

name: KeepUp Survival: Mountain Map
summary: A small additional Free Mountain Map. Explore this cute little map, go hunting and build a nice shelter.

name: Kenbo
summary: On the warpath again comes a former military man named Kenbo, he swore not to kill again, but some special services again want to recruit him, so Kenbo took up arms and promised to kill anyone who comes to him.

name: Kegani Friends
summary: Crabby Friends is a doujin fighting game whose cast features a diverse bunch of giant, anthropomorphized crabs.

name: Key Escape
summary: Key Escape is a precision platformer, where your goal is to pick the padlock and return to the door to get to the next level.

name: Kemono Friends Pavilion
summary: This game puts a Kemono Friends spin on Neko Atsume. Players leave out toys and Japari Buns to attract Friends. The player doesn't directly interact with the Friends when they visit, but can watch them while they play and receive gifts of Pikapika crystals when they leave. Crystals can be spent on new toys or fancier Japari Buns. In addition, the player can complete various challenges by observing special events in-game; witnessing these requires the player to attract particular combinations of Friends to the park at once.

name: Kenny Dalglish Soccer Match
summary:
Kenny Dalglish Soccer Match is a computer game based on Scottish ex-football player and manager Kenny Dalglish - who managed and played for Liverpool, Blackburn Rovers, Celtic and the Scotland national team. Dalglish would also become famous for winning the FA Cup while playing and managing for the same team.

The Australian magazine PC PowerPlay gave this game a rating of 5% in its February 1990 issue.

name: Keitai Denjuu Telefang: Power Version
summary:
In the year 2020 it has become possible to travel to the Denjuu world using D-Shots, special mobile phones. Making friends and sharing telephone numbers with Denjuu has become popular among humans.

The protagonist, Shigeki, despite having originally arrived in the Denjuu world by accident, becomes determined to travel the world with his new Denjuu companion, and make more new friends while he is there.

Keitai Denjuu Telefang (Japanese: 携帯電獣テレファング; Romaji: Keitai Denjuu Terefangu), also known as Telefang 1 (since there are two games in this series), is a video game for Game Boy Color released by Smilesoft in Japan. It is available in two versions, Power and Speed.

The game was not released in English, and is best known among English audiences for the a bootlegged game version which was hacked and sold as a fake Pokémon game.

name: Keyword: A Spider's Thread
summary: Become an investigator in Keyword, a narrative thriller where you’ll depend on skills of logical deduction, hacking, and social engineering to solve challenging puzzles as the only means of finding your missing daughter.

name: Kennan Simulator
summary: Physics Sandbox

name: Keystones
summary: Keystones: a simple game about colors and connections.

name: Kebab Simulator VR
summary: Get ready for a whirlwind of culinary chaos in Kebab Simulator VR! The first, best and only VR Kebab Simulator of the world! Serve up German fast food favorites like doner kebabs, pizza, burgers, and fries. It's a short-lived, single-player rush of frantic fun that'll leave you hungry for more!

name: Kenas-unarpe
summary: A puzzle adventure inspired by the legend of the Kenas-unarpe from Ainu folklore.

name: Kelly Slater's Pro Surfer
summary: Each surfer is represented by a high-res 3-D model that brings their signature style and tricks to life. Take an exhilarating thrill ride down huge wave faces and into barreling tubes, using an intuitive control system and multiple modes of play. Plus, surf exotic real-world locales in South Africa, Hawaii, Australia, Tahiti, Spain and North America.

name: Kelly Club: Clubhouse Fun
summary:
Join Kelly at the clubhouse for a magical adventure!
Play games, earn items for the show, and unlock secret areas filled with surprises!
Show off your skills on stage and amaze the audience with your magic tricks!
Ready to put on a show with Kelly?

name: Keyhole Spy: Hot Nurses
summary: Match identical items to make hot nurses take off their clothes. They know exactly how to cure your boredom!

name: Kessler Syndrome
summary: Alone in orbit with a corpse and no way to reach Earth, play as an astronaut who must keep a defunct space station aloft. Maintain the onboard systems, deal with the constant threat of space junk, and navigate the dark halls in zero-gravity. Day by day more systems fail, and the void draws closer.

name: Ke-Tsu-No-Ana
summary:
Ke-tsu-no-ana is Arcade Style Shoot'em Up Game.
Grab your joystick Let's Go into The Ke-Tsu-no-ana!!!

name: Keiko-chan no Himitsu
summary:
Your tutor Keiko disappeared from the room. You need to find her to continue love lessons.

Adult adventure game created by Champion Soft in 1984.

name: Keep Watching
summary: Keep Watching is a virtual reality horror game. The goal is simple. Escape. You'll need to keep watching though, they move when your back is turned.

name: Kenka ga Tsuyokute Cool de Tsuyoki no Furyou Kanojo ga Yowai Boku o Kabatte Kegasaremasu

JOIN KENDALL & KYLIE JENNER as the up-and-coming star of a big new adventure... choose your own path – the story is yours!

BE YOURSELF, EXPRESS YOURSELF! Create your own character from hundreds of the latest styles, and share customized pics of your digital self.

YOUR FOLLOWERS ARE WAITING! Start a life in fashion, media, and more... make your mark and increase your online following.

name: Ken to Mahou
summary:
Set in a medieval world called Border Land, an evil wizard has besieged the kingdom, killing its benevolent ruler and taking the princess captive. With the land swept in chaos, the player must brave numerous challenges to defeat the wizard and restore peace. Nine character archetypes may be chosen as the player's avatar; each one is given a unique set of attributes, affecting their battle performance.

Explore towns and castles for various recovery spots, while engage in one-on-one battles with varying physical attacks and magic effectiveness, based on the player's chosen class.

name: Keep This Land
summary: Heavy metal, battle wizardry and blood of monsters from the deep. Will you keep this land from evil?

name: Kentucky Dash
summary: Kentucky Dash is an endless autorunner where you race to see who can get the furthest.

name: Keyspace
summary: Place keys into each level to help you get from point A to point B.

name: Kebab it Up!
summary: Kebab It Up! is a fast paced game that will push your gaming skills to their maximum in a catastrophic world full of obstacles, only to catch the much-loved kebab.

name: Kellogg's Gut Bacteria Reef
summary: Explore the human gut like never before!

name: Kenka Bancho: Zenkoku Seiha
summary: Kenka Bancho: Zenkoku Seiha is a social game in the Kenka Bancho franchise for smart phones, "feature phones", and PC.

name: Kenophobia
summary: A Psychological Horror Backrooms Found Footage Game

name: Keribato

name: Keep Combo

With this specil affection, I make a game, KEEP COMBO, to pay my respects to all casual games which had touched my heart, also to pay my respects to the palyers and gameplatforms at that time.

name: Keeper!

Be careful though - these fish are ready for a fight, so choose your lure wisely or you could end up with an empty boat and wounded pride. Master your approach, and you'll be giving KVD a run for his money!

summary: A Furry Visual Novel

summary:
Follow the intricate paths of Celtic stones in an exciting race for the highest score.
Play numbered cards to move your figures as far as possible along the colored paths of stone and try to collect valuable wishing stones and bonus points on your way to beat your opponents!
A clever strategy playing your cards, collecting tiles and choosing paths and some luck of the draw lead to victory. Play as many cards as possible in the right order - but never lose track of your opponents' tactics!

name: Kensei
summary: Kensei is a branching narrative RPG where you can influence events as a Samurai, a Ronin, or a Monk. Set in 1612 Japan, the game features a historical fiction based storyline which ends with the most famous duel of all time.

name: Key Hunters DX
summary: Key Hunters DX is an re-imagined version of Sonic & Knuckles: Key Hunters!

name: Keef the Thief: A Boy and His Lockpick
summary: Originally released for the Apple IIgs, Keef the Thief is a unique parody role-playing game about a young thief. The game and puzzles are quite absurd, but strangely addictive. Some inside scoop from developer Naughty Dog's website: "Keef was a classic sword and scorcery role-playing game. While we were making it, Andy entered sarcastic text as a place holder for what we believed would be the real text in the final release. EA liked the humor so much that they decided to make the entire game a comedy. The effect that this decision had on sales was no joke, however."

name: Kevurah Horror Tale
summary: In Kevurah, you drive through a forest where you must reach a funeral that you must organize, bringing the various objects you have in your car into the funeral. All this while something torments and pressures you about the funeral.

name: Kentucky Robo Chicken
summary: Help the Robo Chicken get the stolen light bulbs back!

name: Kewlbiverse
summary: Kewlbiverse is an open-world monster adventure that fits right in your pocket. In Kewlbiverse, you can tame and work alongside uniquely designed monsters, build your dream home, and adventure with your friends.

name: Keep It Together
summary:
You are a coat full of rats living in a modern society, trying to pass as human. 
 
If you want to keep living the life you've come to appreciate, you best not let anyone discover your true identity! Just make sure you say the right things, don't upset anyone, and keep that coat held shut at all costs!

name: KeyBoard Guitar Master

If you like old style rock guitar songs, please don't miss this one.

name: Keeper

name: KEL Reaper of Entropy
summary:
Tired of playing the part of a wannabe hero in games? Bored of helping villagers get rid of the local undead? Why not play as one of those undead for a change?

KEL Reaper of Entropy gives you the chance to control (or at least try to) Kel the Skeleton and choose whether to terrorize or please the villagers. Or both for that matter. The game features unconventional gameplay, heinous methods of gaining victory and a non-existent variety of ways to customize your character. Plus an overdose of twisted humour as a bonus.

name: Kemco RPG Selection Vol. 6
summary: Kemco RPG Selection Vol. 6 is a bundle of multiple games in the J-RPG genre.

name: Keyboard Drumset Fucking Werewolf
